Lastly, I told reporters that House Dems will continue making progress on our #ForthePeople agenda. In July, we’ll pass defense and intelligence bills, the #RaisetheWage Act, compensation for 9/11 victims, and Senate-passed legislation to disapprove of arms sales to Saudi Arabia.

I also told press the House will pass the SAFE Act this week to strengthen the security & integrity of U.S. elections & defend our democracy against foreign interference. House Dems are upholding the oath we made to defend our democracy. I urge House Republicans to vote with us.

At my press conference today, I told reporters the House will pass 10 appropriations bills before the end of June – the first time that’s happened since 2006. The House is doing its work. I urge the Senate to act & the GOP to work with us to reach agreement on funding levels.

#OTD 75 years ago the GI Bill was enacted to help WWII veterans pursue education, job training, & home ownership. I’m proud that I helped advance the New GI Bill in 2009 to support those who served after 9/11. I will continue advocating for our nation’s veterans, service members.
Wishing a happy birthday to @RepAdamSchiff, Chairman of @HouseIntel. Thank you for your leadership in Congress to keep America safe, protect our democracy, and hold the Administration accountable.

This weekend marks the longest period of time without an increase in the federal minimum wage. I brought the last minimum wage increase to the Floor & another raise is overdue. I'm working w my colleagues to bring the #Raise the Wage Act to the House Floor for a vote in July.

Happy belated birthday to Chair of @HASCDemocrats, @RepAdamSmith. Thank you for your leadership in supporting our troops, strengthening national security, and working to keep America and our allies safer.

On this day, let us remember, regardless of party, we are all united as fellow Americans.

As House Dems kick off our #HealthCareWeekend of action,  I joined @RepAnthonyBrown & community stakeholders in Largo to discuss health disparities among minority groups in #MD. While the #ACA took great strides to expand affordable health coverage, there is still much to do.

Today @HASCDemocrats marked up a defense authorization bill for 2020. It is shameful that all but 2 Republicans chose to make this vote partisan, denying troops a pay raise, rejecting critical defense initiatives, & ignoring the requests of our military. https://bit.ly/2WJndwH

My thoughts are with the family and friends of Jordan on the anniversary of his death. I join with the entire Terp family in honoring Jordan’s memory today. We must continue to work together to prevent a tragedy like this from ever occurring again.

House Dems are working on legislation to strengthen our election security and address foreign interference. I call on Republicans to join with us to make clear that we will not allow any foreign nation to interfere in our elections.

Thank you @HouseIntel for holding today’s hearing on key findings from the Mueller report – foreign interference in our democracy. We must safeguard our democracy and ensure Russian or any foreign interference does not occur again. https://twitter.com/HouseIntel/status/1138795142561894401 …

Happy birthday to my good friend, @RepRoybalAllard. Thank you for fighting to protect #Dreamers as author of #HR6 and your great work on @AppropsDems. Our caucus is advantaged by your experience, expertise, and leadership on immigration & many other critical issues.

I stand in solidarity with the people of Hong Kong who are courageously taking to the streets to defend democracy and freedom of expression, and I join in expressing my strongest opposition to the extradition law proposed by the Chinese government. https://bit.ly/2WAh7to

Thank you to @RepStephMurphy, @RepDarrenSoto, and @RepValDemings for your work to designate #Pulse as a federally recognized national memorial and provide a place where all Americans can come together to remember and honor the victims and survivors. https://twitter.com/onePULSEorg/status/1138153859971461121 …

Today marks the three-year anniversary of the horrific mass shooting at #Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida. I join in remembering the victims, honoring the survivors, and thanking those who heroically responded that day to save lives.

Reports that the # of fatal opioid overdoses have decreased in MD are encouraging, but there is more work to be done to address this epidemic. We must continue to increase funding for treatment & work w local partners to reduce the number of overdoses. https://wapo.st/2wOtaca

I'm glad the House passed H.R. 2476 yesterday. This important legislation will establish a grant program to protect places of worship & nonprofit organizations from terrorist attacks. We must work to ensure all are safe in synagogues, mosques, churches, & other places of worship.

I hope you’re all following @TheBlackCaucus to see the important work they’re doing. I won’t give away what year they were founded, but I’m grateful they’ve been serving as the Conscience of the Congress since that date. When Democrats won the Majority, we made a promise to the American people to hold the executive branch accountable. Today, we passed a resolution to ensure the House can exercise its responsibility to uncover all the facts and discover the truth on behalf of the American people. pic.twitter.com/p2EEkMfxgY

As a strong and longtime supporter of voting rights for DC residents, I am glad the Democratic-led House joined an amicus brief yesterday in support of DC residents seeking recognition of their fundamental right to Congressional representation. https://bit.ly/2KOcTvY

Finally, I told reporters that Dems are leading a Health Care for All Americans Weekend & will be hosting district events across the country. Americans are deeply concerned about the price of health care & prescription drugs. We're working to directly address those concerns.

I also told reporters that the House will begin consideration of appropriations bills tomorrow, which provide funding for priorities like workforce training, education, and medical research. It is my intention to pass all 12 funding bills so we can avoid another #TrumpShutdown.

During my weekly press conference today, I discussed today’s vote on a resolution to enforce subpoenas. This is about Congress’s ability to conduct its constitutional responsibility. I urge House Republicans to join us in supporting the resolution on the Floor

Ken Cuccinelli's extremist views on immigration and his lack of serious qualifications make him wholly unsuited to lead @USCIS.  Opposition to his confirmation is broad and bipartisan, and it ought to be heeded by @POTUS instead of blatantly ignored. https://bit.ly/2wLjBuH

#OTD in 1963, President Kennedy signed the Equal Pay Act to end pay disparity, but 56 years later the wage gap persists. For 32 years, Bernie has worked tirelessly to make a complex environmental issue understandable for #MD05 families. I remain thankful for his leadership and commitment to ensuring Pax River and the Chesapeake Bay are healthier for future generations. pic.twitter.com/0fMXyAvzH8

It was a great day to wade into the Patuxent River this afternoon with my friend Bernie Fowler. Bernie’s sneaker index is a non-scientific measurement used to test the health of the river. This year’s sneaker index measured at 47 in. – an improvement of 11 inches from last year.

Wishing a happy birthday to new Member @RepKendraHorn. Thank you for your work serving as Chairwoman of the @HouseScience Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics and for your strong advocacy for women in leadership.

Great to stop by the Prince George’s County Housing Fair in Landover this morning. Glad to meet with #MD05 constituents and learn more about the resources available for families in our community. pic.twitter.com/i17uMCjQQa

We cannot accept the epidemic of gun violence in our country. The House has acted by passing #HR8 & #HR112, commonsense legislation to #EndGunViolence. I urge Senate Republicans to take up & pass these bills now to prevent violence in our communities. #WearOrange #Enough
Happy birthday to new Member @RepSusanWild, a powerful advocate for quality, affordable healthcare for #PA07. Thank you for your work on @EdLaborCmte & @HouseForeign.

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend @repbenraylujan, who is doing an outstanding job as Assistant Speaker in the 116th Congress. Thanks for all you do for the Caucus and for your work on behalf of families & small businesses in New Mexico.

Standing in solidarity today with those gathered in #Prague demanding transparent and accountable government, 30 years after the Velvet Revolution that brought freedom and democracy to the Czech people.

Wishing a happy birthday to new Member @RepHoulahan. Thank you for your service in the @usairforce & your work on behalf of #PA06 in Congress on @HouseSmallBiz, @HASCDemocrats, & @HouseForeign Committees.

Moving the @USDA outside of the National Capital Region would harm the morale of federal employees and undermine their mission. DC residents have no stronger champion than @EleanorNorton. I have long joined her in advocating for voting rights for District residents & I’m so proud to cosponsor her statehood bill. As we mark #CapitolHillOceanWeek, the House passed 4 bills to #ProtectOurOceans. The United States must use its relationship with China to push for the human rights and freedom of its people, just as we did for those living behind the Iron Curtain during the Cold War.  We must never abandon our solidarity with those who yearn for freedom.

Today, people around the world stand in solidarity with victims & survivors of the Tiananmen Square Massacre. We mark this anniversary at a time when the Chinese govt continues to engage in a systematic repression of Muslims, Tibetans, and other minorities & political dissidents.

House Dems are working to ensure more of our people can #MakeItInAmerica. House Dems continue to be focused on ensuring Americans have access to quality, affordable health care. I thank @EnergyCommerce for holding an important hearing this morning on reauthorizing health programs that benefit millions of Americans. #ForthePeople https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1135907808052883457 …

I thank @HouseJudiciary Committee for holding a hearing today on the systematic effort by Republican lawmakers across the country to take away reproductive choice and access to health care for women. We’ll explore all options to #StopTheBans. https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1135949598936248320 …

Lastly, I told reporters that the House will begin consideration of funding bills on June 12. It’s my intention to pass all 12 bills by the end of the month. We also need to reach an agreement to lift budget caps, and I'll be urging @POTUS to work with Congress to do so.

I also told the press that the House will vote next Tuesday on a contempt resolution. The Trump Administration is engaged in the biggest cover-up in history, and House Democrats will continue to pursue the facts on behalf of the American people.

During my weekly press conference, I told reporters that the House will vote on #HR6, the American Dream & Promise Act. After years of GOP inaction, the House is finally acting to protect #Dreamers and those with #TPS and #DED status and ensure they have a pathway to citizenship.

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend & new Member @RepChrisPappas, who is working hard on behalf of #NH01 on @TransportDems & @VetAffairsDems. I hope you enjoy some ice cream from @PuritanBackroom to celebrate.

I join in wishing #EidMubarak to all celebrating in #MD05 & around the world tonight. I share w them & w all Americans my prayer for the year ahead to be filled with only joy and peace, understanding and cooperation as we pursue a better future together. https://bit.ly/2JVbmox

The House has now passed the bipartisan disaster relief supplemental after it was delayed by House Republicans. I hope @POTUS will sign it swiftly into law so emergency funds can be released to help American communities rebuild from recent disasters. https://bit.ly/2ItMDVh

This Administration’s systematic refusal to provide Congress with answers and cooperate with Congressional subpoenas is the biggest cover-up in American history, and Congress has a responsibility to provide oversight on behalf of the American people.

Next Tuesday, I will bring a resolution to the House Floor forcing Attorney General Barr and former White House Counsel McGahn to comply with Congressional subpoenas that have been duly issued by the House Judiciary Committee. https://bit.ly/2WLgdOU

Glad to join @RepKarenBass and foster youth today to discuss policies Congress can pursue to support those in foster care & ensure they can succeed. I was honored to speak with so many inspiring young leaders. Together, we’ll continue to work to raise #FosterYouthVoices. pic.twitter.com/jNNYvD1IGs

Proud to work w the Liberian Community Association to urge @POTUS to reverse his decision to end DED for Liberian Americans. Together, we worked to ensure that DED status was extended for those individuals. I will continue to advocate for the many Liberians that call #MD05 home.

Glad that @NOAA & MD have reached an agreement to designate Mallows Bay a National Marine Sanctuary, a designation I’ve been working to achieve since 2014. This overdue designation will protect Mallows Bay for yrs to come & support our local economy.  https://bit.ly/2Wikha6  pic.twitter.com/pGrE8mGvil

Honored to speak to #NLS2019 this afternoon and reaffirm my support for @ADL’s mission to fight back against hate and division. It is incumbent upon leaders of all philosophies and parties to come together to reject the politics of prejudice.  https://bit.ly/2WhreIm  https://twitter.com/ADL/status/1135595083808616450 …

Enjoyed visiting with #MD05 students from Mt. Harmony Elementary School in Owings this morning in the Capitol. I was thoroughly impressed with their interest in civic engagement. pic.twitter.com/lzhLag7Pmo

As we grieve for the 12 individuals killed in Virginia Beach, we must do more to address gun violence. Too many communities in America have endured unspeakable loss. Senate Republicans must take action to #EndGunViolence.

Today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day, a day to honor the victims and survivors of gun violence. House Dems passed bipartisan, comprehensive background checks legislation to help #EndGunViolence and continue to urge the Senate to take up and pass this legislation.

Today marks #NationalTrailsDay, a day of advocacy for public lands and trails. It’s the perfect excuse to get outside today and explore one of Maryland’s beautiful national trails.  https://bit.ly/2VhJoVf

I strongly urge the Senate to take up this legislation and pass it to reassert America’s leadership on the climate crisis. I also look forward to bringing additional legislation to the Floor to address climate change.

Today marks 2 years since @POTUS withdrew the U.S. from Paris Climate Agreement. His decision puts the health, security, & economic prosperity of our country at risk. That’s why I brought to the House Floor the #ClimateActionNow Act to prohibit the withdrawal from the agreement.

As we celebrate immigrants throughout the month of June, we also recommit ourselves to fighting back against the Trump Administration’s efforts to change the very nature of America by closing our doors to immigrants and by mistreating those seeking refuge on our shores.

I join in celebrating #ImmigrantHeritageMonth as it begins today and thank the immigrants and immigrant communities that continue to move our country forward. Let us never forget that our country was built by immigrants & will continue to be in the future. https://bit.ly/2I4F9Yg
As we continue to fight back against this Administration’s disturbing anti-LGBT policies, House Democrats will continue to promote equality, opportunity, and justice for all.

I was proud to bring the #EqualityAct to the Floor last month, & I urge the Senate to pass the bill now and end legal discrimination against #LGBT Americans. The House also took action to disapprove of the Trump Administration’s ban on transgender people serving in our military.

I join in celebrating #LGBTPride Month throughout June, when we pay tribute to those who struggled to achieve the fight for full equality and acceptance – and those who continue that effort today. https://bit.ly/2EG8qrB
Wishing a happy birthday to my friend, @RepLucyMcBath, a leader in our caucus in the effort to #EndGunViolence in #GA06 & across the country.
It’s unacceptable that we continue to have mass shootings throughout our nation. Enough is enough. Republicans must work with Democrats to take action to prevent more tragedies from happening.

Deeply saddened by the tragic shooting in Virginia Beach. I extend my deepest sympathies to the family and friends of the victims, and join in thanking the first responders for their quick response to this tragic event.
